Hic¶

class src.hic.Hic(cooler, chrom, square_side)[source]¶
class Hic¶
This class groups informations about a Hi-C matrix.
cooler¶

Storage of the Hi-C matrix

Type:cooler
resolution¶

Resolution (or bin-size) of the Hi-C matrix

Type:int
chrom¶

Chromosome chosen among all chromosomes in cooler

Type:int
side¶

Number of raws and columns of a numpy array sub-matrix

Type:int
matrix¶

Hi-C matrix of the chromosome chosen stored in a numpy array

Type:numpy array
sub_matrices¶

The splitted Hi-C matrix into N sub-matrices of size side*side stored in a numpy array of shape (Samples, side, side, 1)

Type:numpy array
calculate_cum_length()[source]¶

Calculates and returns the cumulated length from chromosome 1 to N.

Returns:Informations on chromosomes, their length and cumulated length
Return type:Pandas DataFrame
plot_matrix(color_map, output_path)[source]¶

The Hi-C matrix is plotted in a file.

Parameters:
  • color_map (matplotlib.colors.ListedColormap) – Color map for the plot
  • output_path (str) – Path of the output plot
plot_ten_sub_matrices(color_map, output_path, index_list)[source]¶

10 sub-matrices are plotted in a file.

Parameters:
  • color_map (matplotlib.colors.ListedColormap) – Color map for the plot
  • output_path (str) – Path of the output plot
  • index_list (list) – List of the 10 sub-matrix indexes to plot
set_matrix()[source]¶

Set the numpy array Hi-C matrix of the chromosome chrom. The matrix is transformed into an upper triangular matrix and the values are converted in float32, rescaled by log10 and normalized.

set_sub_matrices()[source]¶

Split the Hi-C matrix of the chromosome chrom into N sub-matrices of size side*side. The empty sub-matrices (sum(values)==0) are ignored. The N resulted sub-matrices are stored and set in a numpy array of shape (N, side, side, 1).
